title: Who are the X Factor: Celebrity judges?
text:
Three familiar faces are returning this year. (Picture: Rex)

Simon Cowell’s ITV talent scouting show X Factor returns to our screens tonight with a twist as X Factor: Celebrity will see famous faces compete against each other.

The show will see a line-up of celebs including reality stars, actors, television presenters and sportsmen compete to win a record contract with Cowell’s record label, which previously boasted the likes of X Factor formed bands One Direction and Little Mix on its roster.

But who are the judges that will be mentoring (and criticising) the acts through the competition?

Who are the X Factor Celebrity judges?

There’s a panel of familiar faces judging the new series of X Factor: Celebrity this year.

Dermot O’Leary is back on board as the host, alongside the ever white-shirt wearing Simon Cowell as a judge, with two more of his former X Factor judging pals (but no, not Cheryl this time guys, sorry!)

The X Factor Celebrity judges this year are:

X Factor would not be the same without Simon and his white shirts (Picture: SYCO/THAMES TV/PA)

Simon Cowell

Simon Cowell has a long history of making stars out of ordinary people with talent, starting with his very first TV talent show in 2001, Pop Idol, through to his globally successful talent scouting reality shows Britain’s Got Talent and X Factor.

Simon founded Syco Music in 2002, to which he has signed some of the biggest names in pop, including Camila Cabello, Harry Styles and of course One Direction and Little Mix.

Simon, who turned 60 this year, has been married to his wife Lauren Silverman since 2013 and together they have one son, named Eric.

Nicole Scherzinger is back on the judging panel again (Picture: SYCO/THAMES TV/PA)

Nicole Scherzinger

Nicole Scherzinger is no stranger to the X Factor judging panel and is back again this year to help Simon find the celebrity with the best singing star power in the brand new series.

The former Pussycat Dolls performer first appeared on the X Factor UK as a judge in 2012 where she mentored the Boys category and went on to see her act James Arthur win the show.

Nicole has been a judge on four different series of the X Factor in the UK in total, but has also appeared on the US version of the show as a judge in 2011 with Paula Abdul.

Nicole, who was born in Hawaii, is 41 years old and her debut studio album, Killer Love, which she released in 2011, was preceded by her number-one single Don’t Hold Your Breath.

Louis Walsh will be back on our screens this Saturday night (Picture: SYCO/THAMES TV)

Louis Walsh

Advertisement

Ireland-born Louis Walsh and his pal Simon Cowell go way back, having worked together on Popstars back in 2002, which Louis won with his reality show-formed girl band Girls Aloud. Louis went on to manage the band, seeing them sell a million singles and propel their debut album to platinum.

Walsh first appeared on the X Factor in 2004 as a judge, along with Simon Cowell and Sharon Osbourne. When he appeared on the show as a judge again in 2005, his act Shayne Ward went on to win the competition.

After a brief break in 2007, Louis returned to the X Factor in 2008 to judge to show along with Dannii Minogue and Cheryl and his band JLS finished as a runner-up. Louis appeared as a judge on the X Factor again in 2009, 2010 and 2011.

In 2012 the Irish band manager returned again and judged the show for the first time with Nicole Scherzinger along with Tulisa and Gary Barlow.

Louis continued to appear on the show until 2018, when he announced that he would no longer appear as a judge on the show because: ‘The show needs a change and I’m ready to leave.’

However, he clearly couldn’t stay away for long and is now back in 2019 to team up with Nicole and Simon to judge the show once again.

The X Factor Celebrity launches on ITV Saturday 12 October at 8.35pm.
